channel.title: What's the code for ::unmute?
channel.description:
If anyone has a code for the command ::umute I would be gateful to have it..
Thanks
La Mod

item.title: What's the code for ::unmute?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“bakatool, post:10, topic:166627”]lol integer and boolean I found out has no difference they are actually both (4 octets)/ 4 bytes of memory on 32-bit computers and 8 on 64-bit computers I always thought a boolean was 1 byte of memory.

but yah of course a boolean would be a better pick here easier to read code that way.[/quote]
But, I’d still use a boolean over an integer.

Read full topic

lol integer and boolean I found out has no difference they are actually both (4 octets)/ 4 bytes of memory on 32-bit computers and 8 on 64-bit computers I always thought a boolean was 1 byte of memory.

item.title: What's the code for ::unmute?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“eric owner2, post:8, topic:166627”]if (command.startsWith("unmute") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(7); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.muted = 0; p.sendMessage("You have just been un-muted by "+playerName+"!"); sendMessage("Successfully un-muted "+command.substring(7)+""); } else { sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Please enter a name that you wish to un-mute"); } }[/quote]
Oh, so it must use an integer as a check.
I would of thought a boolean would of been better, and why would you use an integer if it was going to only be 0, 1? I would of used a byte, I don’t know why but I try to keep my primitive objects the smallest data types they can be, it’s a habit

Read full topic

item.title: What's the code for ::unmute?
item.dc:creator: @eric_owner2 eric owner2
item.description:
@eric_owner2 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("unmute") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(7); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.muted = 0; p.sendMessage("You have just been un-muted by "+playerName+"!"); sendMessage("Successfully un-muted "+command.substring(7)+""); } else { sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Please enter a name that you wish to un-mute"); } }

Read full topic

if (pid < 1) {
sendMessage(“Invalid pid”);
return;/quote][br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 21, 2007, 09:05:39 PM[/size][hr]I still need help here[/quote]
